intro: Echium lineolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting a variety of pollinators including bees and butterflies. Echium lineolatum is often used in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
